title: Doodle Joins Speedy Cousin for a Run and Instantly Regrets Everything - NewsBreak
text: Have you ever agreed to an athletic activity that sounded like a great idea, right up until it wasnâ€™t? Iâ€™ve done this more times than I can count. If you know that feeling, youâ€™ll relate to this Doodle on a deeply personal level. What started as a cheerful spring jog with his speedy cousin quickly turned into a hilarious case of instant regret. Just a few bouncy steps in, this floofy pup realized he was in way over his head. Watch his change of heart in the laugh-out-loud video shared by @twistandmav on April 26: I get it, Murphy! I also have some athletic friends Iâ€™ve joined for outdoor activities, and I regretted my choices once we hit the trail! Though this adorable Doodle mightâ€™ve been begging to tag along with his well-conditioned cousin Maverick, he was only 2/10 of a mile in when he knew heâ€™d made a mistake. Related: The 6 Most Popular Doodle Dog Breeds and Poodle Mixes, According to a Veterinarian On the bright side, at least he figured it out early instead of a mile or more in. And you canâ€™t blame a guy for trying or for knowing what he wants. Some of us just arenâ€™t born to run . Watch Maverick get his run club pals pumped up in this video! People could relate to Murphyâ€™s exercise regret. @nifferq remarked, â€œWanted to be included until he realized what inclusion meantâ€”weâ€™ve all been there.â€ @haleycspohrer added, â€œMurph is my ideal dog!â€ And @anet_and_makai joked, â€œWeâ€™ve all been there: go to the run club because the cute guy invites you, then you realize you are at a RUN CLUB.â€ ðŸ¶ SIGN UP to get â€œpawsitivityâ€ delivered right to your inbox with inspiring & entertaining stories about our furry & feathered friends ðŸ¾ðŸ¾ According to the AKC , some breeds, like Belgian Malinois , Weimaraners , and Vizslas , are natural-born runners , while others, like many Doodles, prefer to walk. Factors like age, size, and energy level can influence whether a dog is a sprinter , a stroller, or a professional couch potato. And based on this video, Murphy knows which category he belongs in. While some of us are like Maverick, many of us have a bit of Murphy in us, too. Ambitious at first, but happier to cheer from the sidelinesâ€¦ and thatâ€™s more than okay!
